page.title: 12Health
page.content: Meadowlea hospital is an old tudor style house set on a hill which caters for old age pensioneres in the Penyffordd area.The building itself was originally a private residence but was converted into a T.B. isolation hosptal in about 1950.The hospital is now a geriatrics home whose general aim is to make O.A.P's last years as comfortable as possible. Meadowleas has not got the facilies to cope with emergencies and the operating theatre and x-ray wards have since been shut and turned into other ammenities.The hospital caters for approximately 70 patients of which the majority are women.The hospital does not provide a service for local people so a surgery is held in an old converted house in the town centre.The surgery is held 3 times weekly by doctors from outside the area.1
